Recap: Michelle has another flashback of her mother. Sebastian meets RJ, finds Cassie's coin and tells RJ that he's here to claim his birthright as well as for revenge. Cassie sends Tammy to get Sandy's computer so that Reva can see if there is anything on there about Jonathon. JB gets to the computer and deletes all of the files that he sent to Sandy. Reva finds out that Jonathon may be dead and that Sandy knew about it. Dinah gets drunk and begins stripping on top of a pool table. Edmund is called and comes to her rescue.
Transcript: Maureen: Oops, dropped that one. We're going to have to toss it. It's too bruised to use. Now, Michelle, I'm going to let you in on this secret of Grandma Bee's famous apple pie. It's all about slicing the apples nice and thin, like this. Watch please. I want you to learn how to do this so that you can help stuff pies for next summer's barbecue. Now remember, nice and thin slices and lots of cinnamon. That's the secret.
Michelle: Mom. Why is this happening?
Tony: Hey.
Michelle: Hi.
Tony: What's up?
Michelle: Oh, nothing. Nothing. I was just...
Tony: Just remembered something? Hmm? From the past?

Cassie: Oh.
Sebastian: Oh.

Cassie: Who are you?

Cassie: Blake told me you were in town. Hi. It's nice to meet you.
Sebastian: Same. Do you mind? Is it a bad time?
Cassie: No. Come on in. Come on in.
Sebastian: Thanks.
Cassie: I was just going to see my sister. But I can wait a few minutes.

Cassie: She's recovering. How'd you know?
Sebastian: Blake.
Cassie: Of course. (Laughs)
Sebastian: I take it news travels fast with my sister around.
Cassie: Yeah, you could say that.
Sebastian: Mm-hmm. Nice. Nice. My father told me about this place, but it's not exactly the way I pictured it.
Cassie: Yeah, we've done some remodeling.
Sebastian: That explains it. Maybe you can explain something else to me.
Cassie: Well, I can try.

Dinah: Let's... let's pump it up. Let's do it.
Bartender: I found your card in her pocket. You want to help me out here?
Dinah: Whoo! (Guys talking and laughing)
Edmund: I think she's doing just fine.
Dinah: Whoo! (Guys talking and laughing)
Man #1: Oh, yeah. Come on. Oh, yeah.

Michelle: Big deal. I remembered something. Whoo-hoo. What did you have for lunch yesterday?

Michelle: It was just like the other ones. I remembered my Mom, Maureen.

Michelle: Yeah, I had a couple. One of them was really disturbing, because I think I was at my Mom's funeral. But the others...
Tony: Thank you.
Michelle: Thanks. The other two were really warm and comforting.
Tony: Well, that's good, right? That's what they're supposed to be. Moms are supposed to be that way, right?

Michelle: Yeah, but you know the other weird thing, Tony? Is that every time I get one of these flashes of memory, I have this coin with me. And I never even had one of these until after that guy Sebastian came around and told me that his father gave this coin to my mom.
Tony: Okay, so what? Is that why you're not getting rid of it when I told you to the other day?
Michelle: Well, it is kind of like my connection to the past. My Mom.
Tony: Okay.

Michelle: And, Tony, I've got to tell you, I love the way I feel when I remember her. I mean, I thought getting my memory back was going to be like someone holding a pillow over my face. But instead, it's just been like a feeling of being wrapped in a blanket. I'm just kind of wondering if it's going to happen again.
Tony: Well, I think it will. It will. I mean, what? This is four, five times now?
Michelle: Third.
Tony: You know, I'm just curious that had I not walked in here right now, would you have told me any of this stuff?
Michelle: Maybe not.
Tony: Didn't think so.
Michelle: Look, I like how we are together.
Tony: I know.
Michelle: And me telling you that I remember the past, you know, that might change what we have right now. And I don't want that to change.

Sebastian: Cassie, look, we just met. You don't have to justify your decision to me. I just hope that you're safe, you know, because Dinah seems unpredictable, dangerous.

Dinah: Why don't you be me for a day, huh?
Edmund: I was. And like you, I got a second chance, and unlike you I didn't blow it.
Dinah: Oh, is that what you think I'm doing, blowing it?
Edmund: Well, let's see. You're on a pool table in a bar taking off your clothes. You draw the conclusion.
Dinah: You know what? Why don't I just let you in on a little secret, huh? Since you and I love secrets. It was much easier being a princess.
Edmund: Well, how nice. I found being a royal not very rewarding.
Dinah: Oh, no, it was just easy being somebody else, you know, playing a role, living life by a script.
Edmund: Oh, so, it's just play-acting?
Dinah: That's right. I loved the respect. I even loved the attention even more. Huh?
Edmund: Isn't that what drives everything you do? Don't you just love the attention? Isn't that what's behind this little display?
Dinah: Oh, my gosh, Edmund, you know me so well. Yeah, that's what I want, just a little more attention.
Men: Yeah!
Dinah: Why don't you go back to Green Acres, hoe the back 40 and shuck some corn?
Edmund: Well, "it is the place to be." Enjoy your hangover. Excuse me, gentlemen.
Dinah: Fine, go, walk away. That's what they all do. That's what Hart did until he met his little slut Cassie.

Sebastian: (Laughs) you think? Sebastian. It's Latin. It means venerable. That means people should respect me.

Sebastian: Well, it comes from a very great roman warrior who lived about 2,000 years ago, Sebastianus. And his own men shot him with a bunch of arrows. Did anyone ever tell about your Granddad Roger, the guy that you're named after? No? Well, he was a very great man too, and he was powerful and brave, and just like Sebastianus, all of the people in this town shot him with many, many arrows. Yeah, and he told me all about them. And I didn't know your Granddad Roger until I was all grown up. But I'm going to make sure, RJ, that you remember him always. That's why I'm here, you know. Well, that's why he sent me. Part of the reason, anyway. I'm also here to claim my birthright... and yours. And who knows? Maybe I'll get a little revenge while I'm at it.

Michelle: Except I'm a little bit scared, you know, because every little bit of memory that I gain, I'm afraid I might lose a bit of who I fought so hard to be since this explosion.

Reva: He had Jonathan's account pulled up on the computer, and he was stealing from the safe.
Cassie: Exactly. If you hadn't caught him, he'd be long gone by now.

Reva: I don't know if I can believe it. I mean, the feelings all seem so real, and he never wanted to tell me he was Jonathan to begin with. I had to drag that out of him. But maybe that was all a part of the plan. It's just... when I look at him, I mean, the feelings are still...
Cassie: Reva. You know, I hate to bring this up, but do you remember when I caught him watching tapes of Richard?
Reva: You thought that he was missing his father. I mean, we both did.
Cassie: He was doing his homework.

Cassie: I took him to Richard's grave. You showed him photo albums. We coached him to be Jonathan.
Reva: I've got to know the truth. His computer.

Reva: He kept slamming his computer shut every time I came around, and he was acting very suspicious.

Tammy: Okay, yeah. Why? What's going on?
Cassie: Nothing. Reva just needs to look at it. The key is under the planter out back, all right?

Cassie: Okay. Thanks.

JB: My pleasure. Rise and shine, buddy.
Sandy: You don't belong here.

Sandy: No.
JB: No?

Sandy: It was you?

Dinah: Would you just leave me alone?
Edmund: What were you thinking?! Do you have any idea what could have happened to you in there?

Dinah: (Laughs) okay, let me see. Do you know that I was raised by a traveling freak show? I've been banished from a country. I've been in prison. Haven't been able to see my family. Dinah: Teach me.

Edmund: How I did what?

But you're a good guy, Edmund, and you just got the world by its tail, a new lease on life.

Dinah: A momentary lapse, that's not a big thing.
Edmund: Well, remind me to remind you of that next time you try to blackmail me.

Dinah: I just want to know how you did it. What's your secret? I mean, what do I got to do? Do I just stay invisible? Do I become the Mother Teresa of Springfield? Do I save trees, raise orphans? What do I do? Because I don't... (sobs) this anger is hurting so bad inside of me, and I don't have any place to go. Except for this lousy bar.
Edmund: Hey. Hey. Hey. Hey, um... (keys jingling) take these. They're keys to my apartment at Towers. You can stay there until you pull yourself together. (Shuffling money) take that, and take a cab.
Dinah: Why are you doing all this?

Edmund: I guess I'm just trying to give you the same thing that was given me. Hey, hey, hey, hey.
